content: I have a zippo Cigarette lighter that was given to me while I worked at the Local VAMC as a Service Officer. on the bottom an ID has been affixed with the following info- LANCE A. MCGOUGH 625-72-39 USNR GLEN ELLYN, ILL. It was found on a beach(I am not sure where) and I would like to return it to him if anyone out there knows of him or a relative of him. He is probably a Viet Nam era Veteran. My email address is azdora@msn.com. Thanks for any input you may give me to help find Lance. Neil Dora
reply: I have a zippo Cigarette lighter that was given to me while I worked at the Local VAMC as a Service Officer. on the bottom an ID has been affixed with the following info- LANCE A. content: I don't know who you are referring to, but the Zippo has a long history with the military. If you are ever around Bradford, PA - stop in at the Zippo Museum and factory and you will see all sorts of neat stuff. Good luck with your search.
reply: I don't know who you are referring to, but the Zippo has a long history with the military. If you are ever around Bradford, PA - stop in at the Zippo Museum and factory and you will see all sorts of neat stuff. Good luck with your search.

content: Before I became a GI (seems like yesterday), I used to work at a place called Grimm Industries in Fairview PA. I was the line lead for the Zippo display assembly line. Ever wonder how that plexiglas got bent in a perfect circle? Yeah, me neither till it became my job.
reply: Before I became a GI (seems like yesterday), I used to work at a place called Grimm Industries in Fairview PA. I was the line lead for the Zippo display assembly line. Ever wonder how that plexiglas got bent in a perfect circle? Yeah, me neither till it became my job.

content: I had a Zippo I bought in the Ship's Store when I was serving aboard the Robert H. McCard(DD-822) and the USS Belleau Wood(LHA-3). I've lost both of them, as 25 years or so have passed. Since both ships are now decommed, is it possible to get Zippos with the 3-D ship's outline/silhouettes on them anymore? -Thanks...- LHA-3 Rusty
reply: I had a Zippo I bought in the Ship's Store when I was serving aboard the Robert H. McCard(DD-822) and the USS Belleau Wood(LHA-3). I've lost both of them, as 25 years or so have passed. content: This isn't any Type of scam. I have over 15,00 Volunteer hours at the vA belong to the VFW, DAV, American Legion and Korean War Veterans. I would like to return the Zippo no strings attached. It is very ornate to say the least, and it would be a nice story to pass on to familys invoved. Neil Dora Oh also a life member of the Amvets

content: As a guy who went the 4 yr route I guess we all had a zippo at onetime or another. I merely was given this one that Lance apparently lost, and thought I would try to return it to him or a family member, as it might have some sentimental Value to them. If I am unable to locate him or a relative I will send it to the Zippo Company for them to display or trashcan, whatever. Neil Dora
reply: As a guy who went the 4 yr route I guess we all had a zippo at onetime or another. content: I had been awarded a Zippo clone (too bad it wasn't a Zippo. I guess Redstone Arsenal couldn't afford the real thing). I lost it snoozing on a stack of duffels in the troop ship hold. I ran across a guy on deck trying to pawn it off. When I described it and told the guy to just give it up and I would not bring charges (he hesitated to give it back even when I offered him a couple a bucks reward), he did give it back and wouldn't even accept the offered reward. If I had lost it for good and somebody found it, I'd love to have it back and jump on the chance. Good luck finding the guy. Update us, will ya?
reply: I had been awarded a Zippo clone (too bad it wasn't a Zippo. I guess Redstone Arsenal couldn't afford the real thing). I lost it snoozing on a stack of duffels in the troop ship hold. I ran across a guy on deck trying to pawn it off. When I described it and told the guy to just give it up and I would not bring charges (he hesitated to give it back even when I offered him a couple a bucks reward), he did give it back and wouldn't even accept the offered reward. If I had lost it for good and somebody found it, I'd love to have it back and jump on the chance. Good luck finding the guy. Update us, will ya?
